biography.value:
This small, draconic humanoid struts as though it were ten feet tall. It wears the gilded skull of a small dragon as a helmet, and its beady eyes gleam out through the skull's sockets. It hefts its spear and shield and lets out a blood-curdling shriek, signaling the attack.

While most kobolds are scuttling scavengers or pathetic sycophants, a few carry a spark of draconic nobility that can't be ignored. These few forge their tribes into forces to be reckoned with, rising to the rank of chieftain. A kobold chieftain stands proud, clad in war gear of fine quality and good repair. Their weapons are tended by the tribe's tinkerers, particularly evident in their springspike shields.

Living Legend.

A kobold chieftain is more than a leader, it is a symbol of the tribe's greatness. The strongest, most cunning, most ruthless of a kobold tribe embodies their connection to the revered dragons. When a chieftain sounds the call to battle, the kobolds meld into a fearless, deadly force.

description.value: The kobold makes three Spear or Shortbow attacks.

Melee Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+6]]{+6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ([[/damage 2d6 + 4 type=piercing]]) damage, or 13 ([[/damage 2d8 + 4 type=piercing]]) damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+6]]{+6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 ([[/damage 2d6 + 4 type=piercing]]) damage, or 13 ([[/damage 2d8 + 4 type=piercing]]) damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/r 1d20+4]]{+4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 ([[/damage 1d6 + 2 type=piercing]]) damage plus 7 ([[/damage 2d6 type=poison]]) damage, and the target must succeed on a [[/save ability=constitution dc=12]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=poisoned] for 1 minute. A &Reference[condition=poisoned] creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: Inspiring Shriek (Recharge after Short or Long Rest)

description.value:
The kobold chieftain shrieks a draconic battle cry. Each creature that isn't a dragonborn or kobold within 30 feet of the chieftain must succeed on a [[/save ability=wisdom dc=14]] saving throw or be &Reference[condition=frightened] for 1 minute. A &Reference[condition=frightened] creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Each dragonborn and kobold within 30 feet of the chieftain is inspired for 1 minute. Whenever an inspired creature makes an attack roll or saving throw, the creature can roll a [[/r d4]] and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

effects.name: Inspiring Shriek (Recharge after Short or Long Rest)

description.value: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the chieftain hits with it (included in the attack).
Dragons and kobolds within 30 feet of the chieftain can't be &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=frightened].

The kobold chieftain has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the chieftain's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't &Reference[condition=incapacitated].
While in sunlight, the kobold chieftain has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (&Reference[skill=Perception]) checks that rely on sight.

When the kobold chieftain is wielding its shield and is hit by a melee attack within 5 feet of it, the chieftain can fire one of its shield spikes at the attacker. The attacker takes 5 ([[/damage 2d4 type=piercing]]) damage.
Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.
